Fiction or Nonfiction?

Can you remember when you first realized you loved reading? Was it fiction or nonfiction? I can, I was eight years old and had recently fractured my foot. There I was watching my siblings run around playing tag football with my parents while I was stuck on the porch, unable to do any physical activity. I just sat there pouting. My mother looked over at me with pity and told me she would be right back. So she went inside and grabbed a book and came outside and said "here try reading this I think you will like it since you seem to like the things I liked as a kid." The title was The Hitchhiker by R.L.Stine, and instantly I was hooked. It was there and then I learned I loved fiction books. I couldn't get enough and became an adamant reader.

Now of course, many can agree with me that fiction books might be a more favorable category, but in reality we might read more nonfiction than we realize on a daily basis. For example history, academic texts, travel guides, self help books, how-to manuals, etc. As you can see, we tend to read alot of nonfiction on a daily basis without even realizing it. So on the following pages I put a list of most favorited books of nonficiton and fiction over the years and where to find them. Now it is time for you to choose which category you feel fits you more.

Alyssa Harper © 2023
